qas.question: What maritime institution of higher education existed in Plymouth as of 1880?
When did the Royal Naval Engineering College shut its doors in Plymouth?
What was the Royal Naval Engineering College renamed in 1959?
In what year did the Dockyard Technical College close?
After the Dockyard Technical College closed, where were classes relocated to?

context: The city was also home to <a0_0>the Royal Naval Engineering College<a0_0/>; opened in 1880 in Keyham, it trained engineering students for five years before they completed the remaining two years of the course at Greenwich. The college closed in <a1_0>1910<a1_0/>, but in 1940 a new college opened at Manadon. This was renamed <a2_0>Dockyard Technical College<a2_0/> in 1959 before finally closing in <a3_0>1994<a3_0/>; training was transferred to the <a4_0>University of Southampton<a4_0/>.
